Topic.Title: Yahoo news focuses on Mitt Romney instead of Obama scandals

Message.Msg: No longer MSNBC. It's just NBC now but same bunch. Mark Levin used to refer to them as "MSLSD" because of their awful reporting. Yahoo is an internet portal not a news company. Yahoo would do far better copying all of the headlines from DrudgeReport who had over 27 million hits in the last 24 hours. Yahoo has long paid a staff to review and post news friendly to Democrats and "attack" news against republicans. When Bush was president Yahoo would rant about the same irrelevant story against Bush for weeks staright. There had to be something negative about Bush on Yahoo homepage everyday as if it were some sort of a goal. Back then about a decade ago, Yahoo stooped as low as treason while providing aid and comfort to our enemies during time of war.

Message.Title: Goldman Joins Alibaba Loan With $500 Million
Message.Msg: HONG KONGâ€”Goldman Sachs Group Inc. GS -0.11%has joined nine other banks in an $8 billion syndicated loan to Chinese e-commerce company Alibaba Group Holding, a person with knowledge of the matter said. Goldman is providing $500 million in the three-tranche loan, which is currently in a syndication process, the person said Tuesday. http://online.wsj.com/article/SB10001424127887324063304578524621146473356.html?mod=WSJ_qtoverview_wsjlatest

Message.Title: Yahoo Will Be Bought for Over $40 per Share After Alibaba IPO
Message.Msg: Yahoo will continue to buy media content along with very high count Unique Visitor sites with Alibaba money and then the biggest bidding war in history will begin with Microsoft, Apple and Google throwing money to Loeb and Mayer and with a few other wannabees (including Chinese investors) also trying to buy Yahoo as well. $40 to $45. When the Alibaba IPO hits, Yahoo will shoot up and this moment will exist no more. Patience is how I made my fortune and how I build it. This is not for day traders in their pajamas, this is for the big boys...like me. Mop up with me or cry in your beer later. Yahoo is the sexiest stock around. Don't kick yourself for having missed it. Bookmark this message. Those who cash in will remember it with fondness; those who don't will want to push it forever out of their memories.

Topic.Title: Yahoo is selling out to the extremely annoying Advertisers . New management certainly needs to be replaced.

Message.Msg: I wonder if they intend to ruin things for viewers, advertisers and investers. If they wanted a web site to work for both viewers and advertisers, there would be a display ad seamlessly sitting to the side in most web pages like how advertisers used to do in print newspapers that everyone read. The ad would not be annoying, it would not make viewers hate the media or advertiser. Unfortunately, many web sites are destroyed by annoyances. Such as pages that are extremely painfully slow to view if the computer or softwear doesn't crash. Many video ads are very annoying. The audio noise is also annoying. And the pop-up ads or spam or telemarketing clearly destroys the web site for viewer or members. It looks like such web design is intended to fail for viewers as well as advertisers. And in the long term it fails the who ever owns the web site because viewers simply go elsewhere and the advertisers will know that.

Message.Title: Experiencing Hair loss
Message.Msg: Recently I have been experiencing hair loss everyday I have hair coming out and I feel that my hair has gotten less. I have never had this problem my hair never came out this much ever before. I am very worried I am 19 years old and I have no clue what is happening because my hair literally falls out a lot everyday, and I have not been stressed or anything it just recently started to fall out so much that I am becoming so worried and scared.

Topic.Title: Experiencing Hair loss

Message.Msg: You have to see a doctor, there are lots of health issues that can make health fall, especially if doesn't run in your dad's or mother's family. Good luck!

Topic.Title: Experiencing Hair loss

Message.Msg: You could have a para-thyriod problem! You may want to start with a specialist first and not a family doctor.

Message.Title: 'Banks Jostle for Piece of China's Alibaba'
Message.Msg: "With a deadline looming on Friday, banks are lining up to lend money to Alibaba Group Holding Ltd., the Chinese e-commerce giant, in the hope of getting picked for a role in its expected initial public offering. On Tuesday, Goldman Sachs Group Inc. GS -1.15% joined a group of banks that is lending $8 billion to Alibaba. The company could be worth between $50 billion and $100 billion and could hold an IPO as early as in the fourth quarter of this year, though the first half of 2014 is more likely, people familiar with the deal said. While Alibaba hasn't picked underwriters for its listing yet, it is widely believed among Hong Kong-based bankers that lending money to the company is a prerequisite for working on the IPO. Alibaba declined to comment. The company is expected to list late this year or in 2014. Goldman Sachs joined banks lending $8 billion to Ali Baba. . According to bankers who have had dealings with company, the IPO will likely be in Hong Kong, with a possible dual listing in the U.S. Alibaba, which owns Taobao, China's dominant retail e-commerce site, declined to comment on the potential deal"

Message.Title: April's COMSCORE comming this week
Message.Msg: Will Wednesday/Thursday be the final month that Yahoo will reclaim the #1 Spot? For May, is going to be difficult, as the Alexa site shows a weakness in The global numbers...The shutdowns and the mail issues are impacting May visitors numbers (but with the Tumblrs numbers...)

Message.Title: Yahoo Apps performance update
Message.Msg: According to App Annie: 1.Yahoo app remains in the #10 position on news. 2.Yahoo mail remains Top #5 in productivity in iphone and Top #3 in productivity in ipad, and Top #75 overall in ipad. 3.Yahoo weather remains Top #3 in weather. 4.The Flickr app went from Top 75 to Top 20 on Photo and Video after the upgrade and went from Top 700 overall to top 250. 5.On Tumblr after a big bump after the acquisition, they went back to their prior acquisition averages of top 10 in social networking and top 75 overall. (No massive migration!)

Topic.Title: Bolling bands tightening up. Any positive news and this could pop big. I'm going to load up on July 29's

Message.Msg: I did the same thing last Thursday. I saw ONLY an upside for this stock. With huge growth potential, strengthening revenues, increasing user base. Then BAM, apple farts a little noise. Stock plummets 17% in three days and im $100,000 less richer. Im on your side, HUGE growth potential from here at these prices for say Late July early Sept? But the way I look at it, the Shorts are going to win this battle, this stock WILL hit $13 before it hits $16, so why by? With the Fed's news and everything else going on in the market, P is only headed down short term. So, Ive loaded up on PUTS, figured if I cant beat them...you get it. Once it hits $13, ill switch and hit the other direction. Just the other day I bought 20,000 calls for June with a $15 strike. Took a $35,000 beating on those alone and they were half of it... I also have some June $25 strikes that apparently are literally worthless today. Only thing im saying to you here...let the floor come out before getting those calls. Could get them while the stock is at $11, who know. Happy trading!
